DataElement.preferredName: Patient Lost Institutional Review Board Approval Follow-up Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to acceptance as satisfactory by an oversite group responsible for approving clinical trials protocols and monitoring adherence to established protocols having patient deemed lost to follow-up in the past.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Lost Institutional Review Board Approval Follow-up
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related to acceptance as satisfactory by an oversite group responsible for approving clinical trials protocols and monitoring adherence to established protocols having patient deemed lost to follow-up in the past.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Lost Institutional Review Board Approval Follow-up
Property.preferredDefinition: Lost; parted with; no longer held or possessed.:An oversite group responsible for approving clinical trials protocols and monitoring adherence to established protocols.:Approved; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.

Concepts.definition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained.

A specially constituted independent review body comprised of medical, scientific and non-scientific members established and designated by an entity to ensure the protection of the rights, safety and well-being of human subjects recruited to participate in biomedical or behavioral research according to the requirements outlined in Title 38, part 16 (same as Title 45, part 46 and Title 21, part 56) of the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations. IRB responsibility include but not limited to the reviewing, approving, and providing continuing review of trial protocol and amendments and of the methods and material(s) to be used in obtaining and documenting informed consent of the trial. Other equivalent committees with the same or similar functions are also considered to be IRBs.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
